# Load in data and summarize, look for glaring errors:
```{r}
data<-read.csv("2018_Data_MAS.csv",header=T)
headtail(data)

str(data)

###################
#
#     Data Management: Columns formatting
#
###################

# Date
levels(data$Date)
data$Date<-as.Date(data$Date, format = "%m/%d/%Y")
str(data$Date)


# Lake
summary(data$Lake)
data$Lake[data$Lake == "SIlver"] <- "Silver"
data$Lake[data$Lake == "silver"] <- "Silver"
data$Lake<-droplevels(data)$Lake

# TAG.NUMBER - Already a factor
summary(data$TAG.NUMBER)
data$TAG.NUMBER[data$TAG.NUMBER == ""] <- NA # set non-tagged fish to NA
summary(data$TAG.NUMBER)
    # don't think anything else needs to be adjusted. mis-keys would be terrible.

# Species
levels(data$Species) #KOI could be an issue
data$TAG.NUMBER[data$Species == "KOI"]
data$Species[data$Species == "KOI"] <- "COC"
data$Species<-droplevels(data$Species)
# Confirm the abbreviations: yellow bass or yellow bullhead?

# Length..mm.
data$Length..mm.[data$Length..mm. ==""] <- NA
data$Length..mm.<-as.numeric(data$Length..mm.)
str(data$Length..mm.)
summary(data$Length..mm.) # seems legit! only 26 missing values. 
# MAx should be more than 641! we had 800s and more man!
# potentially missing silver lakes then?
#
#



```
